FuncDef:
The snmp-agent trap source-port command specifies the number of a source port that sends trap messages.
The undo snmp-agent trap source-port command restores the default number of the source port that sends trap messages. The snmp-agent trap source-port command specifies the number of a source port that sends trap messages. The undo snmp-agent trap source-port command restores the default number of the source port that sends trap messages. By default, the source port that sends trap messages is a random port.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a number for a source port that sends trap messages.
The value is an integer ranging from 1025 to 65535.

ExtraInfo: To improve network security, run the snmp-agent trap source-port command to configure a specific port to send trap messages. Therefore, the user terminal's firewall allows packets with the specified port number to pass.
